results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 9
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Douglas Sharp
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Times are tough and the economy is failing. When the factory heads agree that the only way to save costs is to downsize, Alan must use all his abilities to try and save the jobs of his friends in the factory. Eventually Alan decides to leave and return to the country to begin his career as a writer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Douglas Sharp

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 8
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Douglas Sharp
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Following his dismissal from his previous job, Alan finds work at a boot factory in Melbourne, quickly proving his worth and moving from part time to full time employment. Despite emersing himself in his work at the factory and his writing, Alan notices Biddy, a quiet employee at the factory, and the two quickly become a couple, leading to a series of events including the purchase of Alan’s first car.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 7
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Keith Wilkes
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. When a story he submits is rejected, Alan, age 20, returns to the city to work. Quickly applying for a clerical position, Alan is offered the job, on the condition he accepts less than the award wage. On the condition that if after 6 months, his employer, Mrs. Smalpeck, is pleased with his work, she raise his wage to match those of equal capability, he agrees. Boarding at a local boarding house run by the eccentric Mrs. Birdsworth, Alan continues his observation of the world around him.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 6
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Keith Wilkes
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. After leaving his previous job, Alan discovers finding work is not as easy as it seems, continually being rejected due to his disability. While his constant walks through the city looking for work, have enabled him to meet a number of people and write their stories, he soon decides to return home and concentrate on his writing.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 5
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Keith Wilkes
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Adult Alan (played by Lewis Fitzgerald), is taken into the city by his father, and soon is employed as a clerk. Boarding in the local pub means meeting a wide variety of people, and Alan’s country naivete is quickly discovered and exploited by the locals. Eventually Alan settles in and makes friends and continues to maintain his notebook and his ambition to be a writer.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 4
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Adapting quickly to life with crutches, Alan constantly tries to keep up with the other boys and do all the things that they do. His father’s friend Mr. Radcliff learns of Alan’s ambition to become a writer, he encourages Alan to start keeping a notebook, to note down good stories and yarns, and to constantly experience new things, as all these things will help him to become a great writer. When a family friend invites him to go camping, Alan takes along his notebook and goes along to experience ‘life’.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 3
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Alan is determined to ride his pony Katie again, however his father forbids it, as he says there is too great a chance of Alan getting hurt or killed, as his legs are no longer strong enough to grip the horse and he has trouble maintaining his balance. At school, Alan overhears a classmate complaining about exercising his pony at lunchtime, and quickly volunteers to do it, despite his father’s warnings. Although his riding is belittled by his school teacher, who tells him to focus on learning, as he is destined for a desk job, Alan continues, and eventually shows his father what he can do.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 2
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Following his operation, Alan is in extreme pain, although at first his anguish is dismissed by the nurses. The doctor prescribes sunshine as medicine and Alan ventures into the world for the first time in months. Quickly learning to get himself around on his crutches, Alan goes home, and despite being pushed around in a modified pram, returns to school, and falls in love with Maggie Mulligan. When he is challenged to a fight by another classmate, and wins, Alan earns the respect of his classmates.

results.title: I can jump puddles. Ep. 1
results.creator_credit: John Gauci, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: A 9 part television serial about Australian author Alan Marshall, from his childhood and his diagnosis with Polio to his adulthood as he struggles to become a writer. Based on his three autobiographical novels “I can Jump Puddles”, ‘This is the Grass” and “How Beautiful are thy Feet”. Growing up in rural Western Victoria, young Alan Marshall loves running, writing and horses. When Alan is diagnosed with Polio and becomes bedridden, his family do all they can to help him, including straightening his legs with force. When 3 months of home treatment makes no change to his condition, Alan is sent to hospital, to have his legs operated on. While there, Alan’s friendly nature and good spirits quickly capture the love of the nurses and the camaraderie of the men in the ward.

results.title: I Can jump puddles = I'm jumping over puddles again
results.creator_credit: Filmove Studio Barrandov and Karel Kachyna
results.brief_description: This award winning film, based on Alan Marshall’s heartwarming book, has transferred the setting from the Australian outback to a huge stud farm in the picturesque countryside of Moravia, a part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire at the turn of the century. Adam, the energetic son of a horse trainer contracts polio and is hospitalised. He is still determined, however, to fulfil his constant dream of riding a horse, and he persuades his friends to help him in secret. Czech language with English sub-titles. Not suitable for children.
results.title_for_label: I Can jump puddles = I’m jumping over puddles again
